text: I'm gonna set off this video by telling
you a story that happened to me the last
time I was in Myanmar five years ago and
I've never told it to anybody before so
pay attention because it's important so
last time I came here I was a full time
travel blogger and I had collaborated
with a local tour company to help plan
my trip and it went really well I met up
with the guy who owns it his name was
psy and he was super friendly we got
along really well we hung out for
several days together here in Yangon
where I'm shooting this video right now
and we really connected and long story
short I went on the trip I went back to
my home in Korea at the time I wrote the
blog post all about my experience in
Myanmar it went really viral it gave him
so much business and we stayed in touch
and he always told me that he was really
thankful for me of how I helped his
business and it was very mutual
beneficial and a win-win all around and
I just have very very good memories of
my time in Myanmar with side well
unfortunately about three years after
that
I got an email from a lady who went on a
tour with psy and they were travelling
outside of young bones so they were
driving they were in two different cars
and she told me that he had gotten in a
car accident and he passed away and it
really hurt me because we were really
close and we had gotten along really
well and I had just talked to him like a
few weeks before I got that email and to
this day it's really really bothered me
a lot and she had told me in that email
that he was not wearing a seat belt
and that is the reason that he passed
away the driver survived what he did it
and so this memory of psy has just been
haunting me since then and anytime I
came across the word Myanmar or thought
about this country I immediately thought
about sigh so now I'm back in Myanmar
and with Deanna we've been having an
awesome time so far over the last four
days really enjoying everything but I
can't stop thinking about sigh and what
happened and I've been analyzing these
streets and the drivers really do drive
poorly crossing the street here it's
like a nightmare you gotta be really
careful and even worse is that every
taxi I've been in doesn't have a seat
belt in the back
so I'm literally sitting there in the
car trying to find the seatbelt which is
not even there you can't grab the seat
belt here or it's sometimes there and
there's no buckle so I'm driving in a
taxi now and young Berlin and this is
the fourth one I've been in without a
seat belt it's literally not even a
buckle for any seat belt here and it's
extremely dangerous because the driving
conditions are not safe the people are
cutting each other off they're driving
really fast
I'm scared I can't protect myself
because I don't have a seat belt so it's
really frustrating to be driving around
young on where the drivers are crazy and
I can't even protect my safety with a
seat belt this is a problem I'm making
this video is kind of a PSA and a stunt
to the people of Myanmar to the
government of Myanmar that you guys need
to fix this for the safety of your
locals and the safety of the tourists
because I wanted to bring my parents
here and now I'm having second thoughts
a won't feel safe to be in the taxi
without having a seatbelt this is
already a standard measurement across
the whole world to have a seatbelt and
in many countries it's also illegal to
not have a seatbelt especially where I
come from so here in Myanmar there needs
to be laws implemented that all being
said this is my sixth and final video
and this Myanmar series I will end on a
positive note and say that I really
enjoyed my time here so far I'm sorry
that this video is negative but it just
has to be said I can't let it slip off
my mind especially what happened to my
friend psy and considering what I've
experienced here over the last few days
anyways I will definitely be back in the
mr soon I hope when I come back there
will be seatbelts in the car everybody
will be safe and happy as usual thank
you guys for watching my videos
Jai Suba mingalaba and I will catch you
guys later from vanilla
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
